case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_circumstances: On 09/17/1983, these skeletal remains were discovered in a desert wash at the west end of Ann Rd. A .22 semi-automatic pistol was recovered from the scene. Based on clothing recovered, it is believed that the decedent's death took place during the winter time. It was suggested that during the decedent's younger years he was probably around 5'10" but due to severe arthritis, his stature at the time of his death was around 5'8". The decedent also had extensive gold bridgework and numerous porcelain facings that would have been very expensive.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_with_body: Slacks - faded gray or light green - HAGGAR label - 33" waist, Dark brown leather belt, long underwear, Light green insulated ski jacket or windbreaker with hood - Penny's Sports Outerwear, Long sleeve sweater - red/reddish brown, Long sleeve knit shirt - wine or maroon color - Penny's label - Size 16 1/2 L
case_footwear:
Oxford wingtip shoe (for left foot -size 8C)
Brown or black socks
case_other_items_with_body: Tareyton brand cigarettes, Red Cricket lighter, dish towel - white with red striped trim
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
